Issues.Title: fix(platform-server): Ensure correct namespaces are used with Ivy
Issues.Body:
This issue was discovered when debugging #44028. The root cause ended up being the TODO
here which points out a change in the namespaces between Ivy and VE. As a result,
the server renderer was always passing `undefined` as the namespace.

The effect of this for #44028 was that the SVG element was being created
as just an element rather than an SVGElement. [Here][1] is the code reference
for what happens in Domino. Finally, when the animation attempts to
apply to the SVG element, it fails to because the element doesn't have a
`style` property.

Resolves #44028

[1]: https://github.com/fgnass/domino/blob/12a5f67136a0ac10e3fa1649b8787ba3b309e9a7/lib/Document.js#L232-L239
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(platform-server): Ensure correct namespaces are used with Ivy " (#44766)

Issues.Title: docs: add note about using NG_ASYNC_VALIDATORS
Issues.Body:
When setting up an async validator in a template-driven form, it's necessary to register the directive with NG_ASYNC_VALIDATORS instead of NG_VALIDATORS. This was not mentioned in the docs.

Issues.Title: Service worker continuously reloads app
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

service-worker

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

I have an application which continuously reloads because the service worker never manages to register, as the app is trying to download an old build. there is no reason for this build to be downloaded as it is no more referenced in the ngsw.json
![network](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3816312/150100478-423d0223-2b55-4240-b7ba-554a2e017d28.png)
![network2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3816312/150100491-503fc91d-e9e8-4257-834b-0912525e1c0f.png)



### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://app-test.anotemusic.com

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
main.47ab7967795dec49.js is the most up to date version of app. Service worker fails to download main.8663078ebcc02629.js (an old version no more accessible in CDN)


main.47ab7967795dec49.js:1 ERROR Error: Uncaught (in promise): NotAllowedError: Registration failed - permission denied
    at A (polyfills.cd3aac8f98f39e08.js:1:17395)
    at A (polyfills.cd3aac8f98f39e08.js:1:16930)
    at polyfills.cd3aac8f98f39e08.js:1:18237
    at h.invokeTask (polyfills.cd3aac8f98f39e08.js:1:8085)
    at Object.onInvokeTask (main.47ab7967795dec49.js:1:2136672)
    at h.invokeTask (polyfills.cd3aac8f98f39e08.js:1:8006)
    at h.runTask (polyfills.cd3aac8f98f39e08.js:1:3158)
    at m (polyfills.cd3aac8f98f39e08.js:1:10407)
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 13.1.3
Node: 14.16.0
Package Manager: npm 8.1.3
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 13.1.2
... animations, cdk, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... material, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
... service-worker

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1301.3
@angular-devkit/build-angular   13.1.3
@angular-devkit/core            13.1.3
@angular-devkit/schematics      13.1.3
@angular/cli                    13.1.3
@angular/pwa                    13.1.3
@schematics/angular             13.1.3
rxjs                            7.5.2
typescript                      4.5.4
```


### Anything else?

Maybe a clean browser does not suffer from issue, as incognito mode seems ok for now? But strangely enough, https://app-dev.anotemusic.com is currently unaffected!

Now the resulting issue is that content that would be transcluded in the wrapper component via ng-transclude, can't be processed and produces an error in the console. The simplified problem: Angular Component: ``` @Component({ selector: 'ng2-component', template: `
Transclude:

<--- Problem arises here ` }, ];) ``` ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-downgrade-transclusion-error ### Please provide the exception or error you saw ```true preview-a214a06f7a20.js:2 Error: [ngTransclude:orphan] Illegal use of ngTransclude directive in the template! No parent directive that requires a transclusion found. Element:
https://errors.angularjs.org/1.8.2/ngTransclude/orphan?p0=%3Cdiv%20ng-transclude%3D%22%22%20class%3D%22ng-scope%22%3E at eval (angular.js:138) at Object.ngTranscludePostLink (angular.js:35000) at eval (angular.js:1391) at invokeLinkFn (angular.js:11376) at nodeLinkFn (angular.js:10695) at compositeLinkFn (angular.js:9942) at publicLinkFn (angular.js:9807) at eval (downgrade_component_adapter.ts:50) at Array.forEach () at DowngradeComponentAdapter.compileContents (downgrade_component_adapter.ts:49) '
' ``` ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular CLI: 11.2.14 Node: 14.18.2 OS: darwin x64 Angular: 11.2.14 ... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, upgrade Ivy Workspace: Yes Package Version ------------------------------------------------------------ @angular-devkit/architect 0.1102.14 @angular-devkit/build-angular 0.1102.14 @angular-devkit/core 11.2.14 @angular-devkit/schematics 11.2.14 @angular/cdk 11.2.13 @angular/material 11.2.13 @angular/material-moment-adapter 11.2.13 @schematics/angular 11.2.14 @schematics/update 0.1102.14 rxjs 6.6.3 typescript 4.1.6 webpack 4.44.2 angular 1.8.2 ``` ### Anything else? _No response_

Issues.Title: Feature Request: Improve error messages regarding animation-related attributes on special elements
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/releated to the feature request?

animations, compiler, core

### Description

### Feature

This issue is for taking into consideration improving the error messages for the case when animation-related attributes (as far as I can tell those only include triggers and `@.disabled`) are used on special elements (`<ng-template>`, `<ng-content>` or `<ng-container>`).

This probably needs to be added in the template type-checking subsystem as well as to the runtime (under ngDevMode, so it's tree-shaken away in prod bundles).

___

### Explanation:

For example see here:
![145676817-e91f2aff-14a5-4c5f-86b6-4a59511f0a21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61631103/150013632-7e2e1e4a-3eec-4207-bc65-d133cf6998b1.png)

We only get runtime errors in the console saying that the animation attributes are not know properties of `ng-template`/`ng-container` the suggestion here is provide more useful error messages prompting the user not to use animation-related attributes for special elements since the attributes will not take effect for such elements

___

### Current Behavior

We get the aforementioned runtime errors in the console but the application runs without issues (naturally no animation is applied to the special-elements), the application also gets built without issues.


### New Proposed Behavior

Provide new warnings for this issues during the compilation of the application (both during development and builds) and also improve the existing runtime errors to provide more useful information to the users.

(Alternatively we could make the compilation fail as it encounters such cases, but that may be a bit too much I'd imagine)

Possibly we could also only just update the errors to be more specific as that is also consistent with the animations errors, for example when an animation trigger hasn't been registered, nothing breaks but simple a console error is presented to the user:
![Screenshot at 2022-01-18 20-54-03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61631103/150017129-72b9ddd0-778c-458b-bdad-6495d3ab1ab6.png)
ensuring the same sort of behavior here could be good for consistency and it would also not cause any breaking of current functionalities (note: the console error appears both locally and in production builds).

___

### Extra

The issue relates to the special elements but I am wondering if other elements could/should be included as well, for example I am thinking of `router-outlet` it isn't technically wrong to put a trigger on it, but since it is only a placeholder I am wondering if we should at least warn the user about it (for example if they may think that animating the `router-outlet` can have an effect on the routed components)

___

Original conversation: https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/44378#discussion_r768286077
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Feature Request: Improve error messages regarding animation-related attributes on special elements" (#44747)

Issues.Title: Wildcard/dynamic routed component is not rendered when navigating from/to itself
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Components with dynamic routes do not render but only when navigated from dynamic component itself.

Consider this scenario:

Application with some static routes like `/user`, `/dashboard` and so on. Application also has dynamic routes that come via JSON CMS. The CMS pages work like this:

- Navigate to any route e.g. `/foo-bar`
- Get content from CMS based on this URL
- Render the content if it exists
- Show 404 page if it does not exist

With version 11 it was working fine, however starting with version 12 navigating from these dynamic urls to different dynamic urls does not work. (Actually navigation happens, you can even see it when you set `enableTracing: true`, **the component is not displayed**)

When you click on any static route e.g. `/user` it works fine, if you are on any static route first navigation to any dynamic page will work fine as well.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-idy2ak?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.module.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
There is no error, however as you can see the component content is not rendered. Also you can see a very slight lag for URL to change (so something weird definitely is happening)
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 13.1.3
Node: 16.13.2
Package Manager: npm 8.1.2
OS: darwin arm64

Angular:
...

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.1301.3 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/core         13.1.3 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/schematics   13.1.3 (cli-only)
@schematics/angular          13.1.3 (cli-only)
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: Libraries built with Angular 13 cannot be consumed in Angular 11 applications
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler-cli

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

I'm maintaining the [Keycloak Angular library](https://github.com/mauriciovigolo/keycloak-angular) and our users are reporting issues installing ever since we have added support for Angular 13. For more information see https://github.com/mauriciovigolo/keycloak-angular/issues/369.

Issues.Title: mouseleave() not firing on disappearing objects
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

The current implementation of `mouseleave()` leads to the following behaviour, which is technically correct, but not logically:

Example (see gif): 

1. I show a fontawesome icon that changes on `mouseenter()` and `mouseleave()`
2. Clicking a button hides the icons and makes new elements appear.
3. Going back and making the old elements appear, the mouse technically never "left" the icons, so the fontawesome icon for the hovering state is still displayed.
4. 
![hover issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11761828/149915996-75e48a13-f8fe-4f9d-9a3d-cbb2da53863d.gif)

I know, technically `onmouseleave()` represents just that, a mouse leaving an element, but logically it did so, when the element disappears. The only workaround seems to be to make the `(click)` reset a hover-state representing var.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 12.1.4
Node: 14.18.1
Package Manager: npm 8.3.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 12.1.5
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1201.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular   12.1.4
@angular-devkit/core            12.1.4
@angular-devkit/schematics      12.1.4
@angular/cli                    12.1.4
@schematics/angular             12.1.4
rxjs                            6.6.7
typescript                      4.3.5
```

Issues.Title: Running tests with code coverage doesn't include files outside the sourceRoot directory
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->

- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [x] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Is this a regression?

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->
<!-- ✍️--> Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: Any time before PR #11974

### Description

<!-- ✍️--> A clear and concise description of the problem...

## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction

1. ng new test-app
2. create packages/test-package outside of src folder
3. add there simple test.component.ts and test.component.spec.ts
4. Modify test.ts file and add context of 'packages directory
replace
```javascript
const context = require.context('./', true, /\.spec\.ts$/);
context.keys().map(context1);
```
with
```javascript
const context1 = require.context('../packages', true, /\.spec\.ts$/);
const context2 = require.context('./', true, /\.spec\.ts$/);

context1.keys().map(context1);
context2.keys().map(context2);
```
5. Add "../packages/**/*.spec.ts", to tsconfig.spec.json in "include" section

6. Run `ng test --code-coverage` and open coverage/index.html

## 🔥 Exception or Error

No error but the files outside the directory are not included in the coverage report.

**Anything else relevant?**

This was reported previously on issue #12474. They simply dismissed it as saying only files under `sourceRoot` are listed on the coverage report. Having the intended behavior be where tests from outside `sourceRoot` are ran but not included in the coverage report seems counterintuitive. They should either both be ran and included in the coverage report or not included in either place.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Running tests with code coverage doesn't include files outside the sourceRoot directory" (#22531)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): load translations fresh start
Issues.Body:
Currently when making a change while serving a localized application, duplicate
translation warnings appear for every translation id. This fixes that by
replacing the whole translation object with a new one each time translations
are loaded.

fixes #22398

Minor version of https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/22460

Issues.Title: Unable to run extract-i18n command due to sourcemapping error
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [x] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 12.2.6 (the bug got introduced somewhere in a patch version of v12 as it's present in the latest version of v12 as well as all versions of v13) ### Description When running the extract-i18n command it fails as there is an invalid sourcemap in the dependency tree. This is what the sourcemap looks like: ``` {"version":3,"sources":["webpack://[name]/webpack/universalModuleDefinition", ...rest], ...rest} ``` I'm also going to open an issue with the maintainers of the troublesome dependency to try and get them to fix it on their end, but I guess the CLI should handle invalid sourcemaps rather than crashing like this. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction ``` git checkout git@github.com:mattlewis92/source-map-bug.git cd source-map-bug npm i # Note: the dependency is a private npm dependency, if you can let me know your npm handle then I can grant you access so you can npm install it npm run extract-i18n ``` ## 🔥 Exception or Error 
./node_modules/@clickup/gantt/codebase/dhtmlxgantt.js - Error: Module build failed (from ./node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/babel/webpack-loader.js):
TypeError [ERR_INVALID_URL]: Invalid URL
    at new NodeError (node:internal/errors:371:5)
    at onParseError (node:internal/url:552:9)

Issues.Title: Unable to serve or build app due to runtime ChunkLoadError
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 13.0.4 ### Description When starting or building our app after upgrading to angular 13 we get a `ChunkLoadError` in the browser console at runtime because webpack isn't emitting a the .js file for that chunk. There are no build errors in the console, and weirdly after a few incremental rebuilds the problem fixes itself. After some digging I found the root cause was this PR: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/22239 If I disable the `NamedChunksPlugin` in the webpack config, then the problem goes away and everything works as expected. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Reproducing this outside of our app is hard. If you're willing to sign an NDA I can just give you access to the repo to debug it yourselves, or if you can give me some instructions on how to debug it my end to find the root cause I'm also happy to do that. ## 🔥 Exception or Error 
ERROR Error: Uncaught (in promise): ChunkLoadError: Loading chunk default-libs_comment_common_src_lib_comments_comment_module_ts-libs_task_comment-bar_src_lib_-ca5e7c failed.
(error: http://localhost:4200/default-libs_comment_common_src_lib_comments_comment_module_ts-libs_task_comment-bar_src_lib_-ca5e7c.js)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bholloway/resolve-url-loader/compare/4.0.0...5.0.0)

Breaking changes

-   Require `node>=12`.
-   Support only `webpack>=4`.
-   Update to `postcss@^8`.
-   Remove `rework` engine (which was deprecated in V4).

Bugfixes

-   Fix log messages not correctly normalising absolute paths to posix style on Windows platform
-   Fixes to end-to-end tests and test framework.

</details>

Issues.Title: Version 13: Data path "" must NOT have additional properties(i18nFile)
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [x] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version we could serve a specific locale. Now we cannot, or the option changed and it is nowhere told how to do so. ### Description Scenario is very simple. Application has 15+ languages and I need to serve a specific language, in my example: German. I can't anymore because it says that this is not a valid option. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Create an application with two locales and try to launch the one which is not set as default. It seems it's not possible anymore. It used to be possible using this command: `ng serve --configuration=de` ```json "de": { "i18nFile": "src/i18n/messages.de.xlf", <-- ERROR since v13 "i18nFormat": "xlf", <-- ERROR since v13 "i18nLocale": "de" <-- ERROR since v13 } ... "de": { "browserTarget": "frontend:build:de" }, ``` ## 🔥 Exception or Error 
Data path "" must NOT have additional properties(i18nFile)
Build fails and application is not served. Since I see squiggly lines over all three options it is clear that all of them are not valid anymore. ## 🌍 Your Environment

### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Hello, apologies if I'm reporting this in the wrong place - I'm really not sure what's going on.

I am experiencing a Terser error when I try to serve or build my app. 

If I set optimization: false in angular.json, the app will build fine. 

The issue appears to be linked to the AWS-SDK. I have a component that imports the aws sdk and sets config like so:

`AWS.config.update({
      region: "us-east-1"

Issues.Title: Static files are not loaded from wwwroot
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

I have created a new Visual Studio project template with Angular and individual authentication.

If I try to load files from wwwroot, even if it is about css files, js files, images or even translation json files in the assets/i18 folder, they do not load. It seams it is a problem with the proxy configuration because not even the favicon.ico wouldn't load, but if I put the route in the proxy.config.js file, it works:
```js
const { env } = require('process');

const target = env.ASPNETCORE_HTTPS_PORT ? `https://localhost:${env.ASPNETCORE_HTTPS_PORT}` :
  env.ASPNETCORE_URLS ? env.ASPNETCORE_URLS.split(';')[0] : 'http://localhost:45299';

const PROXY_CONFIG = [
  {
    context: [
      "./css",
      "./js",
      "./plugins",
      "./images",
      "/favicon.ico",
      "/weatherforecast",
      "/error",
      "/account",
      "/_configuration",
      "/.well-known",
      "/Identity",
      "/connect",
      "/ApplyDatabaseMigrations",
      "/_framework"
   ],
    target: target,
    secure: false
  }
]

module.exports = PROXY_CONFIG;
```

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

the problem persists with every VS 2022 Angular project with Individual Authentication

Issues.Title: Export module in public api
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->

- [x] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

<!-- ✍️--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
when generting module I would like to use a parameter to automatically add this moduel to public api of a project (library), this way I would not have to do it each time

### Describe the solution you'd like
ng g lib .... --addToPublicApi
<!-- ✍️--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
alternatively we could use --skipPublicApic but that could be a killer for not well maintained apps
<!-- ✍️--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Export module in public api" (#22511)

Issues.Title: Project setup is not starting after Routing and Stylesheet selection
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Nothing is happening after I've selected the routing as "No" and stylesheet as "CSS". No error is shown in the terminal and even after waiting for more than30 minutes nothing is happening. (Screenshot attached
![Angular Project Setup Error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18526842/149714309-617b48e5-8a2b-4de3-8aae-af67c8e5f906.png)
)

I'm following the steps mentioned in: https://angular.io/guide/setup-local


### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
No exception shown on the screen
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 13.1.3
Node: 16.13.2
Package Manager: npm 8.1.2
OS: win32 x64

Issues.Title: build: bump engine.io from 6.1.0 to 6.1.1
Issues.Body:
Bumps [engine.io](https://github.com/socketio/engine.io) from 6.1.0 to 6.1.1.
Release notes

Sourced from engine.io's releases.

6.1.1

:warning: This release contains an important security fix :warning:

A malicious client could send a specially crafted HTTP request, triggering an uncaught exception and killing the Node.js process:

RangeError: Invalid WebSocket frame: RSV2 and RSV3 must be clear at Receiver.getInfo (/.../node_modules/ws/lib/receiver.js:176:14) at Receiver.startLoop (/.../node_modules/ws/lib/receiver.js:136:22) at Receiver._write (/.../node_modules/ws/lib/receiver.js:83:10) at writeOrBuffer (internal/streams/writable.js:358:12)

This bug was introduced by this commit, included in engine.io@4.0.0, so previous releases are not impacted.

Thanks to Marcus Wejderot from Mevisio for the responsible disclosure.

Bug Fixes

  • properly handle invalid data sent by a malicious websocket client (c0e194d)

Links

  • Diff: https://github.com/socketio/engine.io/compare/6.1.0...6.1.1
  • Client release: -
  • ws version: ~8.2.3
Changelog

Sourced from engine.io's changelog.

6.1.1 (2022-01-11)

:warning: This release contains an important security fix :warning:

A malicious client could send a specially crafted HTTP request, triggering an uncaught exception and killing the Node.js process:

RangeError: Invalid WebSocket frame: RSV2 and RSV3 must be clear at Receiver.getInfo (/.../node_modules/ws/lib/receiver.js:176:14) at Receiver.startLoop (/.../node_modules/ws/lib/receiver.js:136:22) at Receiver._write (/.../node_modules/ws/lib/receiver.js:83:10) at writeOrBuffer (internal/streams/writable.js:358:12)

This bug was introduced by this commit, included in engine.io@4.0.0, so previous releases are not impacted.

Thanks to Marcus Wejderot from Mevisio for the responsible disclosure.

Bug Fixes

  • properly handle invalid data sent by a malicious websocket client (c0e194d)
Commits
  • f3b761d chore(release): 6.1.1
  • c0e194d fix: properly handle invalid data sent by a malicious websocket client
  • b04967b refactor: import Node's setTimeout & clearTimeout to prevent ambiguity (#632)
  • See full diff in compare view

Issues.Title: How to analyse anyComponentStyle exceeded maximum budget?
Issues.Body:
I'm coming across an issue where I am seeing the following warning/error when building a project.

`Error .scss exceeded maximum budget. Budget 4.00 kB was not met by 2.36 kB with a total of 6.36 kB.`

When serving my library via Storybook and checking the outputted CSS for each component they are well below the budget limit, but when trying to build an application that imports the library I get the error above.

Is there a way to correctly analyse the bundles to see what is being outputted? From what I can see the stats.json file ran through `webpack-bundle-analyzer` does not list any of the CSS produced.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How to analyse anyComponentStyle exceeded maximum budget?" (#22507)

Issues.Title: Fingerprint assets
Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->

# 🚀 Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->

- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

Angular CLI fingerprints the generated JS output (for example `main.d64e98daf9464b95.js`) which works great with aggressive cache strategies in a CDN.

In the other hand for assets such as images, [the recommended way of dealing with them](https://angular.io/guide/workspace-config#assets-configuration) is to put them in a special folder which Angular CLI copies as-is when building the app. This means that there is no fingerprint and thus causes problems with CDNs cache, as can't know if the requested file changed since last request.

### Describe the solution you'd like

A way of fingerprinting assets such as images that works with Angular CLI.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

We used to use some webpack tricks but none of them work by Angular CLI 13.1.

We also use a Service Worker but doesn't solve the problem: it does keep track of the changes and knows if a non-figerprinted resource changed (as it stores its hash in `ngsw.json`) BUT when it has changed and it's requested to the CDN, the CDN doesn't know about this and can't decide whether it can serve the cached version, or should request a fresh version of it. If it was fingerprinted, as they'd be different filenames, there would be no problems with the cache.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Fingerprint assets" (#22510)

Issues.Title: fix(material/input):  only style .mat-input-elements in a mat-form-field
Issues.Body:
Material input elements only need to be styled when used in material form fields.

Constraining the `.mat-input-element` class inside `.mat-form-field` ensures that any inputs using the `matInput` or `matNativeControl` directive are not styled if they are not in a material form field.

Example use case:
We are a small team building a custom form-field component that uses matInput to communicate with inputs. If the page also has a material form field component, extra styles are applied to all inputs with matInput including our own custom form field.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/input):  only style .mat-input-elements in a mat-form-field" (#24242)

I tried to add component-name and the style class name to the mat-select like

`<mat-select [panelClass]="'component-name logger'">`

and add style in style.css in angular project's root dir so it will affect globally.

```css
.component-name.logger {
    max-width: 700px;
}
```

But now it's forbidden to use global styles because of my team's requirements.

And the elements generated from mat-select doesn't have the property of component-id, so styles in componet-style.css will not affect them.

And I have questioned in [Stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70755717/how-can-i-modify-the-style-of-one-mat-select-but-not-affect-others-on-the-same-p?noredirect=1#comment125085558_70755717)

Issues.Title: We're moving away from positioning the dropdown on top of the select. You can try our new select based on top of MDC's styles. The API and behavior is exactly the same since it shares the same base class as the current select, but the CSS will be slightly different and the dropdown is only positioned above/below. You can try it by importing `MatSelectModule` from `@angular/material-experimental/mdc-select` instead of `@angular/material/select`.
Issues.Body:
Hello,

Any update on when the corrections to the mat-select dropdown positioning might be ready for production? I have a few teams holding off on updating from Angular Material 11 for this reason alone.

Thank you!
Jeremy

We're moving away from positioning the dropdown on top of the select. You can try our new select based on top of MDC's styles. The API and behavior is exactly the same since it shares the same base class as the current select, but the CSS will be slightly different and the dropdown is only positioned above/below. You can try it by importing `MatSelectModule` from `@angular/material-experimental/mdc-select` instead of `@angular/material/select`.

_Originally posted by @crisbeto in https://github.com/angular/components/issues/23625#issuecomment-931448386_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "We're moving away from positioning the dropdown on top of the select. You can try our new select based on top of MDC's styles. The API and behavior is exactly the same since it shares the same base class as the current select, but the CSS will be slightly different and the dropdown is only positioned above/below. You can try it by importing `MatSelectModule` from `@angular/material-experimental/mdc-select` instead of `@angular/material/select`." (#24229)

Issues.Title: help(Upgrade): Unable to finish upgrade from 12 to 13 due to scss issues
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

12

### Description

When upgrading from angular 12 to angular 13 of the material library the upgrade completes successfully but the build fails with cryptic error message.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. clone https://github.com/IsraelHikingMap/Site
2. cd IsraelHiking.Web
3. upgrade angular from 12 to 13
4. upgrade material from 12 to 13
5. run npm run build:watch
6. Build fails with the following error message:
```
SassError: expected "{".
  ╷
1 │ @use "@angular/material" as mat;
  │                                  ^
  ╵
  src/scss/sidebar.scss 1:34  @import
  src/scss/common.scss 6:9    root stylesheet
```


### Expected Behavior

Upgrade should complete successfully and build should pass.

### Actual Behavior

Unable to use material 13 due to this cryptic error which I haven't found a way to workaround or fix.

### Environment

- Angular: 13
- CDK/Material: 13
- Browser(s): N/A
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): maxOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "help(Upgrade): Unable to finish upgrade from 12 to 13 due to scss issues" (#24227)

Issues.Title: help (cdkConnectedOverlay): wrong positioning after updating package
Issues.Body:
### What are you trying to do?

I have a template for sidebar component:
```
<ng-template
  cdkConnectedOverlay
  [cdkConnectedOverlayOpen]="show$ | async"
  [cdkConnectedOverlayOrigin]="{ elementRef: sidebarContainer }"
  [cdkConnectedOverlayPositions]="sidebarPositions"
  [cdkConnectedOverlayHeight]="'100%'"
  [cdkConnectedOverlayFlexibleDimensions]="true"
  [cdkConnectedOverlayHasBackdrop]="true"
  [cdkConnectedOverlayBackdropClass]="'not-existing-class'"
  (backdropClick)="close()"
>
...
```

### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

in package version @angular/cdk@12.2.11, everything works fine but after updating to @angular/cdk@13.1.1 my sidebar can't render to sidebarContainer and render directly to 'body'

What should I do to fix this behaviour or it's some bug in the new version?

### Environment

- Angular: 13.1.1
- CDK/Material: 13.1.1
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System: MacOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "help (cdkConnectedOverlay): wrong positioning after updating package" (#24213)

Issues.Title: fix(material/slider): Ticks updated wrongly if the max property 0
Issues.Body:
When we get equal min & max value for the slider then we can get division by zero which leads to an improper style value for the background-size (Infinity%). This fix introduces a tiny function that checks if we deal with finite numbers during calculations where potentially division by zero may occur.

Fixes #23913
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/slider): Ticks updated wrongly if the max property 0" (#24218)
